thread.title: Crogan’s in Walnut Creek to close after 39 years
thread.title_full: Crogan’s in Walnut Creek to close after 39 years

author: Justin Phillips
title: Crogan’s in Walnut Creek to close after 39 years
text:
Crogan’s in Walnut Creek to close after 39 years By Justin Phillips on January 16, 2017 at 3:23 PM CCFRINITE25-03-C-11AUG00-CF-KW A crowd on the outside deck at Crogan’s in 2001. Photo: Kat Wade/The Chronicle 
With longtime Walnut Creek bar Crogan’s Sports Bar and Grill shutting down on Jan. 23 , it looks as though 2017 isn’t getting better for the some of the Bay Area’s beloved drinking institutions. Just last week, Lefty O’Doul’s announced it was closing in Union Square following a landlord dispute. 
Crogan’s closure revealed the strenuous, long-running relationship it had with the city of Walnut Creek. Some of the details were hinted at in the bar’s recent Facebook post. 
“Unfortunately, the city has made it clear that they have very specific ideas in mind for what Walnut Creek should be and Crogan’s no longer fits into their narrative. Ultimately, we have been forced to close our doors,” the post reads. 
It all can be traced back to last year when Walnut Creek authorities said the bar was a public nuisance, according to NBC reports . Police responded to more than 700 calls there in the last four years — a number the bar’s owners disputed. 
The city then set mandates forcing the bar to stop selling alcohol at earlier times — news Crogan’s also posted on their Facebook page. Last call in 2017 was set between 11:45 p.m. and 11:50 p.m. with the space closing at 12:30 a.m. Sunday through Saturday. 
In the end, it looks like the restrictions made the business untenable. 
“Crogan’s is all our family has known and we’re heartbroken to see it come to an end the way it has,” the Facebook post reads.
